headline: Shop Local? Buy Organic? An Activist’s Call From the ’70s Carries New Urgency
text: MULLUMBIMBY, Australia — Helena Norberg-Hodge strolled into the farmers’ market that she helped start long before it was fashionable. She had come to shop but also to check on friends — especially the farmers living out her ideas about prizing localism and rejecting globalization, for the health of the environment and the happiness of humanity.
snippet: Helena Norberg-Hodge has been arguing for localism since the 1970s, but the pandemic is making the Australian activist-scholar’s ideas more relevant than ever.
